integer.name: maxActive
integer.caption: Max active
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.

integer.name: maxIdle
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.

enum.name: initialisationPolicy
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)

enum.name: exhaustedAction
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.

integer.name: maxWait
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.

integer.name: minEvictionMillis
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.

label.name: connectionLabel
label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure

radioBoolean.name: noReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy

radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.

integer.name: reconnectionAttemps
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make

boolean.name: reconnectForever
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.

classname.name: class
classname.caption: Class
classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.

cloud-connector-message-source.caption: Read From Path
cloud-connector-message-source.description:
Read the content of a file designated by its path and streams it to the rest of the flow, while adding the path metadata in the following inbound properties:
: a boolean set to true if the path exists : an instance of if the path exists. : an instance of if the path exists. : an instance of if the path exists, is a file and has a checksum.
.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file to read.

integer.name: bufferSize
integer.caption: Buffer Size
integer.description: The buffer size to use when reading the file.

string.name: pollingPeriod
string.caption: Polling Period
string.description: Polling Period for Message Sources with Polling Strategy in ms.

name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: nameNodeUri
string.caption: NameNode URI
string.description: The name of the file system to connect to. It is passed to HDFS client as the {FileSystem#FS_DEFAULT_NAME_KEY configuration entry. It can be overriden by values in configurationResources and configurationEntries.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: A simple user identity of a client process.

element-controller-list.caption: Configuration Resources
element-controller-list.description: A of configuration resource files to be loaded by the HDFS client.

element-controller-map.caption: Configuration Entries
element-controller-map.description: A of configuration entries to be used by the HDFS client.

globalRef.name: config-ref
globalRef.caption: Connector Configuration
globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file to write to.

integer.name: bufferSize
integer.caption: Buffer Size
integer.description: The buffer size to use when appending to the file.

string.name: payload-ref
string.caption: Payload Reference
string.description: The payload to append to the file.

string.name: source
string.caption: Source
string.description: The source path on the local disk.

string.name: target
string.caption: Target
string.description: The target path on the File System.

boolean.name: overwrite
boolean.caption: Overwrite
boolean.description: Whether to overwrite a existing file.

string.name: source
string.caption: Source
string.description: The source path on the File System.

string.name: target
string.caption: Target
string.description: The target path on the local disk.

boolean.name: useRawLocalFileSystem
boolean.caption: Use Raw Local File System
boolean.description: Whether to use RawLocalFileSystem as local file system or not.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the directory to delete.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file to delete.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path whose existence must be checked.

string.name: pathPattern
string.caption: Path Pattern
string.description: A regular expression specifying the path pattern.

string.name: filter-ref
string.caption: Filter Reference
string.description: The user supplied path filter.

string.name: filter
string.caption: Filter
string.description: The user supplied path filter.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The given path.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path to create directories for.

string.name: permission
string.caption: Permission
string.description: The file system permission to use when creating the directories, either in octal or symbolic format (umask).

string.name: source
string.caption: Source
string.description: The source path to be renamed.

string.name: target
string.caption: Target
string.description: The target new path after rename.

string.name: groupname
string.caption: Groupname
string.description: If it is null, the original groupname remains unchanged.

string.name: ownername
string.caption: Ownername
string.description: If it is null, the original username remains unchanged.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file or directory to set owner.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file or directory to set permission.

string.name: permission
string.caption: Permission
string.description: The file system permission to be set.

string.name: path
string.caption: Path
string.description: The path of the file to write to.

string.name: permission
string.caption: Permission
string.description: The file system permission to use if a new file is created, either in octal or symbolic format (umask).

integer.name: bufferSize
integer.caption: Buffer Size
integer.description: The buffer size to use when appending to the file.

integer.name: blockSize
integer.caption: Block Size
integer.description: The buffer size to use when appending to the file.

string.name: ownerGroupName
string.caption: Owner Group Name
string.description: The group owner of the file.

string.name: ownerUserName
string.caption: Owner User Name
string.description: The username owner of the file.

string.name: payload-ref
string.caption: Payload Reference
string.description: The payload to write to the file.

boolean.name: overwrite
boolean.caption: Overwrite
boolean.description: If a pre-existing file should be overwritten with the new content.
